comment.author: 74784995@N00
comment._content: Wearing WWII camouflage, and titled British Overseas Airways with Red ,White and Blue stripes underlining the civil registration G-AFCX, Clyde flew to La Guardia Marine Terminal during the Battle of Britain . It also flew to the Congo in 1940 with the French officials who negotiated the alignment of French Equatorial Africa with De Gaulle's Free French
